content.description: Begin on the only holds you can reach off of the ground left of the huge detached block that is always wet.  Reach for the big jug to pull up and gain the slab.  Climb through the slab up to the first vertical section where you will follow a slightly right leaning seam up to the first ledge.  Continue onto the headwall through easier yet sustained climbing.  Reach the second ledge and pull the short roof moves to gain the anchors.
Start below the obvious right facing corner. Pull through some tough moves on crimps after the corner and follow the line straight up through some undulations to anchors below the roof.
content.location: Top of approach trail at new beginnings

content.description: This Route is located in the middle of the New Beginnings Wall.  It starts at the bottom of a left leaning crack.  At the top of the crack break right through nice holds that lead to the first crux.  Small slopey holds lead to a big move to the first ledge.  Rest, then continue up easier but sustained climbing to the chains.  Careful for rope drag if you are going to top-rope.

Stand on the point of the fallen boulder at the base of the climb to reach the first descent holds on the slab.  Follow the slab up and left until it goes vertical.  Move through cool but deceivingly slopey craters until you reach the first ledge.  Climb through main wall on easier but sustained climbing.  Reach the ledge and finish by pulling the 3-4 difficult moves through the roof to get to the chains.

This wall is big and beautiful, the problem is that it is often soaking wet and there are huge death blocks of rock and ice constantly falling from the top.  It could be an incredibly aesthetic area as well if it weren't for the garbage rain created by locals who huck their trash from the top.  Possibly excellent routes, but climb at your own risk.
